I loved this game. Turned base war strategy. Worse part of the game is when I ran out of levels. A skirmish play would be fun. I'll be looking for updates or a third one.
Lots of fun

awesome
Starts out challenging and fun, but as soon as you unlock the cruiser each level becomes trivially easy... Build a cruiser then destroy everything in sight.

Fantastic game, with only a few flaws. I think that the biggest fundamental flaw with this game is its positive feedback loop. DEVELOPERS, IF YOU ARE READING THIS, *PLEASE* watch the Game Maker's Toolkit video on youtube titled "How Games Use Feedback Loops"!!! It's important that developers of strategy games, ESPECIALLY those with permanent upgrades, really understand feedback loops! Currently, the game has been designed to get easier the further you get, until it's trivial, even on Hard mode.
ü§ô
Endless simple fun
Simple and fun I wish they rank will stay for next level
So much fun. No micro transactions just great war game fun

Great game!

Fun game. Wish it was easier to see some of the options. Colors make it hard to read.
Even with PlayPass, there are ad screens. They just show blanks.
Great little game so far
Good, but the latest version doesn't work on S9+
Fun turn based strategy. Controls get a little buggy on a couple units but other than that, quite good.

Great game. GLWG1 had so much potential but ended up being a bit of a bust. This game fixes that by fixing some bugs, adding some unlockables, and making a game that builds up instead of just throws you in. Add to that some better graphics and it's an A+. Not to mention free with the play pass
I love all of the Little War Games
Great game!
Fun challenging and frustrating.
Great turn by turn strategy game

Its a great strategy game thats easy to learn and with the 50 different campaign levels there is plenty to play. The main problem I have with game is who i can screen lock it. You can play this game laying on your side, because the screen always rotates the wrong was. This isn't super annoying but it does make the game less enjoyable. In saying that, it works perfectly fine while sitting or standing.
Great game series! Needs a skip back to your turn with all the consequences still.
great
Love this game

Still freakin' great six years on! I can't believe I'm updating a review about GLWG 2 that I wrote in 2014. But yeah, it's still totally lives up to its name. Just play it, already! Big respect to the dev team. The changes over the years are always good.
It's a lot of fun!

Love this game. Best tactical turn based game I've played so far on mobile. I only gave 4 stars though because of the upgrade system...it doesn't tell u what is being upgraded exactly on each unit when u spend the points u have earned. Please fix and will give it 5 stars. Otherwise great game. Very fun. If u like this try Warlords Of Aternum too. Very good as well
Good tactical fun.
I like it

AI is terrible. Still doing stupid things. Played on hard. You can upgrade your units but you have no idea what your points are buying you. Just costs more. Upgraded my engineer's; did nothing. Has annoying tanks that drive by your screen after each turn. Settings are much more limited than original. Graphics are not as good. This is not an evolution. It's just money grabbing.
Verycool

Fun game. Nice addition to the library.
I love this game. I haven't played it in a long time, it was cool to see it added to Google play pass.

love this game. make more please

Best one yet. Need to make more!!!!
Great game, money well spent
It is an amazing game recommend for strategic gameplay I just wish I had a split screen mode like the first one. And more levels. But great game overall
Great game, fun and challenging.
Would be nice if there were more features. Not sure what. Maybe more customization options, too.
Great Big War Game is much better!!! Interface is clunky, it's like they are trying to do to much with this game. Keep it simple.
Fantastic fun, more of the same - ish... Please send out more maps or another campaign, am I the only one to have purchased all of these games?

I've loved this game for a while now! Think of a cross between Company of Heroes or Command & Conquer with Civilization
I like the graphics But it's not difficult game like the first one very boring game
Entertaining and fun
I have played this game for years and I still love it! A fun, compact real time passer! It would be good to see a update soon maybe some new vehicles or troops? Or maybe game modes?

Well the game is great and all but I wish that the developers would add in extra levels to play, currently now once I'm at level 60 I find the game boring, and my game crashes sometimes due to reasons I have no clue of

the game was fun from when i first played it when it came out so i thought about it and bought it. sadly it was not what i remembered. also that fact that you could buy helicopters and stuff with your stars, but find out you could not use them for another 20 levels was a let down. i do think that need to be fixed into something like you are not allowed to buy anything untill your at least 5-3, because if you buy anything you would want to use it. can i have a refund, this game just made me sad.
i like all the new features but the game is a big let down due to the poor map designs and the fact that it is way too easy to win on the majority of levels even on the most difficult level setting.
Should Not Need To Pay To Play Its Boring(my opinion) May I Plaese Get A Refund.
It is. The. Same. Game

It was going good when I bought it but then it didn't have what I wanted 
and I contacted the developer for a refund and they didn't respond

Good, but the rounds are too short and involve too little 'strategy' for my 
tastes. Only the final game is decent. Other GLWGs are better.
Good little game, would like to be able to reset upgrades and reapply them inbetween levels. Fun addictive good fun.

It's supposed to be easier and more accessible, I get it. The thing is that some missions are too easy, even in the hardest setting. Engineers are very powerful in these small maps, since sometimes 2 turns are enough to take a core enemy building. Place them in a jeep and they can reach even further. Don't get me wrong, it's still a very fun game. And since this is a new game I would like to see more variety, new units, new sound files. It feels like a slimmed down expansion to previous games.
This was just an amazing game their little rymes they say is just so dumb but funny.
Must-have for any Advance War fan
Yeah this was really halfassed. Definitely not as good as the earlier ones... I really enjoyed those.
Enjoyed the prior games, but this lacked any challenge or entertainment value. Small maps, dumb AI, and, with the exception of 2 levels, no challenge whatsoever, even on hard difficulty.
App crash when changing phone orientation. Nexus 5, Lollipop.

Having purchased Great big war game and Great little war game...this is GLWG2 but its the price of GBWG and the worst in the series...its 'sillily' easy...the game is just as silly as the word i just used..total let down...waste of ¬£5
Good Luck!!

Close, but no cigar. The user interface is really good, the game is engaging and entertaining. However the computer is so stupid it's not even funny. Spoiler: most maps can be won in a snap by rushing an engineer to enemy buildings; even at the "hard" difficulty setting. @Rubicon: read these reviews, fix just the AI and difficulty in the next upgrade and get an avalanche of 5 stars.

Whenever you change the orientation of your phone the game crashes. Haven't got a response from my emails months ago. Seems like the developers didn't care when they made this game to begin with or to keep it running. All they cared about was taking the money and running.  Sad because the previous games were so amazing
replyContent: Hope the new build meets with approval...

content: It's mildly addictive but it has a major bug where the screen freezes.  I've had it freeze either when tilting the screen or trying to pan on the screen to view other areas.  When this happens, I either have to hit the home button or wait for it to force close and restart the game.  Sometimes my progress isn't saved.
Cool

I really enjoyed the great little war game series. But this one takes a huge departure from the previous versions. I could deal with a lack of a story line. That would be OK if it weren't for the fact that the maps have no challenge to them. None! It's become ridiculous. With the exception of two, perhaps three, maps all I do now is look for the quickest way to take over the enemy's barracks and boom, it's over. Ho hum. Boring. The others were much more challenging. I'll print play through them again.

Very slickly produced. Be good to see the game either expanded upon, or an original unofficial sequel. Great game that I could probably play forever, but needs a fresh re-imagining, at least. The  predictability of sequel after sequel is fine with good replayable titles like this but it would be good to see what other ideas this fine dev no doubt has rattling around in his/her/their scones. I want the same, different & better...Aaaaagh!

This game is fantastic, strategic fun with lots of levels, maps, and multiplayer options. The only issue is an incredibly irritating bug where the game crashes when you turn the screen. Thankfully, the game autosaves after every move, but the sensitivity of the screen tilting makes the game hard to play without being annoyed. Great game, well worth the $5.99, but until then this bug is fixed, my rating will remain 4 stars.

Can play when the phone normal way up,  but tilt screen landscape like all games should be played,  and it stops working and closes the game. Even if you accidently tilt the phone,  that's it,  all progress lost ,  big let down
Fun, but easy until mission 23 then impossible...
Game crashes in landscape mode, galaxy s6. Refunded
Games fine. Just crashed on me and now i lost everything and it wants me to start all over. Dont no if i can be bothered
No online or skirmish and you gotta buy people. Great big war game is better
When I play the game it not working help l will rate 5 i like this game
A great little c and c type game lots of fun but does seem to be quite resource hungry. Still a few crashes
The first one was great and the second holds up its reputation.

A very good game and it's fun, hilarious and with nice graphics. No IAPs and high replayability were enough to make me buy both I and II, but some report that reviewing is forced, which I think is not OK. Would've liked a random map generator or at least a skirmish mode like the first game release.

It's pretty much the same as the other games Great Little War Game 1 and Great Big War Game with a few extra army units and a new way to unlock those characters. The buttons are smaller and do not look as good, and it's missing the little "video" clips from between each level (which were hilarious). It also crashes everytime my phone rotates! This version seems like a rushed attempt to make money! I probably would have just replayed the older games than bothering to buy this unimproved new version

Other titles are much much better than this...1st time playing and it's on hard. I'm walking through it and the Ai is pathetic in this title. Seriously easy game, just need to make harder then 5 stars.
Loved the first version but this one will not load up. Just keep getting message 'unfortunately... has stopped working' :(
I loved you previous games and paid for the full version.but this one crashes every time you rotate you phone to landscape. Please fix and I will update my review.
Loved first two... Excited by this one. Bought it.. Crashes everytime on opening or trying to play Mission 1..please fix asap !
I loved the other games in this series, but this one crashes so often as to be unplayable.  Too bad  : /
Crashes way to often
1 star for failing to implement something as basic as save game functionality

Finally a developer that understands people will pay for a game up front rather than spoiling it by making it impossible without IAP. Have had all these games and love them, 2 is a great polish to an already wonderful platform. Keep them coming!
Great game as always but often crashes and freezes just like the first one did....making the same mistake again is just stupid
Will request a full refund.
When I rotate my phone during game play, the app completely crashes.
Refuses to open, running on Android lollipop. Please sort this out, I've paid for the game and it simply will not work!  ***update 5/3/15*** STILL NOT WORKING after update
Play US style pound them with atrillery send in troops with medics no man left behind !

***Update****  It took 3 weeks, but they FINALLY fixed the problem. It seems to be working fine now.                                              On mission 21, day 7, the game crashes when I try to end my turn. I've reported it multiple times, but there hasn't been an update to fix it. This is very disappointing, specially since I paid for this app! FIX THIS PROBLEM PLEASE!!!!!
Earlier GLWG games might take you a couple of days to complete a level, GLWG2 lets you complete them in 2 game days ie 2 mins. Very very poor.

I've played both of the previous games in this series and really enjoyed them, but the lack of story, and more importantly, the utter lack of challenge in this most recent addition is disappointing. The computer ai has been nerfed to the point that it's actively hard to lose and I'm 2/3 of the way through the campaign!

I'll not be as nice as others as even with my expectations set low I'm just so disappointed. Poor programming has this chewing through my normally 2 day battery life in a mere hour. Gone are the cute story lines, awesome complex battle setting and well, options... What remains is a generic and very anemic turn based strategy that pales in comparison to its predecessor. Do yourself a favor and get GBWG instead. It is worth your money at least.
I bought the game and played the game. Now it wants me to buy the game!  I like the game but I hate the bug!  I am now blocked until I buy the game but I have already bought the game!!!!!!
I'm a major fan, and own every single one. I feel like being the newest you should've kept the pass & play alive, with skirmish and online play, but even without its still awesome.
The first 2 games were brilliant. This one is good but the maps and missions are too small and too simple. Please make the 3rd version great.
Can't get past level 28 without it crashing,  which is the first vaguely challenging level for those who have played the other games in the series.

I've loved the entire GLWG series, but I have to say this one is the weakest so far. It is fun but way too easy even on the hard difficulty setting. I also don't like the lack of the gold, silver, and bronze trophies for finishing within a certain amount of days.
Had to reset tablet due to naff Google system update. Lost all progress on game. Not good, so uninstalling even though I paid for game.
I purchased the game and now i open it and it says the game is unlisenced complete crap fix it
Same great action as Great Big War Game and same units. Couldn't put it down!

This game has been seriously dumbed down compared to the others. It's too easy to capture buildings & the enemy responds to situations in incredibly inappropriate ways. For example, generating scout tanks in response to my bomber bombarding the enemy HQ.
I bought the game and installed it and then had to clear some memory so I could fit it in then I re installed it and it says this game doesn't have a licence and I have to buy it

Most of the missions are incredibly easy or are just a mirror set up where both sides have the exact same layout. Having single engineers being able to capture buildings is a huge mistake to the game play.  It's just a bunch of skirmishes with simplified combat.  GLWG 1 and GBWG are much much better. No need to waste your money on this.
I open the app and it just pops up: it didn't purchase. Fix this BUG
Plz a accidently got this
Some nonsense error came up today saying the game was not licensed and stopped the game starting... Switched on wifi and could play but it is annoying when I don't always have an internet connection.
Modified engineer behaviour and lack of refuelling make this a much less strategic game than the original.  The AI just doesn't defend against losing its buildings adequately
Sound didn't work to start with, now OK. Let's give it a game
I love the content
I was able to play it a few times, but now I just receive a license error.  I emailed support but did not receive a reply.
I enjoyed this game, for strategy and tactical approach. Also the little warriors too

I've reached a certain level and now every time I end my turn to let the computer play it "unfortunately has stopped". It won't let me go any farther. Something I'd maybe expect from a free game, but not something I've spent money on. :(
replyContent:
Hi Dani, sorry to hear that! Can you tell me what level you're on please?
Does it crash on turn 1 or later in the level? Thanks.
We added Google play services to provide achievements. If you don't log in to that, you're as before wrt anonymity.

content: Have played all the other great little big war games and love all if them... More maps and tanks and troops etc

Had it not been for the first two, I would have rated 5 stars. I only played on normal but the engineers are too powerful with taking over a building in 1 try, the AI does little to really defend itself from these take overs and is lousy in trying to execute its own. No story which was a fun addition in the previous games. All in a good game but disappointing sequel.

Great game, good tactics and challenging. However, it is a bit of a battery hog. Keep your charger around for long play sessions.  Please fix the battery problem. One suggestion is to maybe have an option to turn off animation. This would not only speed up the game but, probably also help on the battery drain issue as there will be less processing. I also get a licensed error message saying to please buy the game. Which I obviously did. I have to kill the process and restart it.
Sorry, but as a fan of all the previous versions this one just has too many niggles.
But today my progress has been lost.
Good game in general but it's too easy, no real challenge, even on the hardest difficulty. The maps are also a bit on the small side and there is no variety in the game types.
Fun and addictive as previous games! Recommend.
awesome :-)
Fixed up a lot of the issues I had with it. Thanks for the updates.
replyContent: You should find some play services achievements in today too, more stuff to come later, including landscape support. (Not trivial given how the menus work so it'll be a week or so)

content: I've always tried to enjoy turn-based strategy games but hated getting bogged down in resource management. GLWG2 has stripped that out, but kept the battle strategy. It's a game for those of us who don't spend 8 hours a day hunched over our machines - most levels require only 5-25 minutes to complete (on easy). Replayability is high - I finished and am playing through again on difficult. I'd like to see more levels or maybe GLWG3. Oh, and thank you for making a game I can buy in one transaction!

This feels like a step backwards for such an awesome series. On the one hand I do like the performance, but I miss customisation. And how do I get an achievement for disabling ads? I already bought it! But the biggest problem is that the early levels need some kind of uber-hard mode for seasoned players, I'm already on level 10 and it's too easy and the AI too dumb (I'm playing hard mode).... Would much rather see and buy expansion packs for GBWG.... Come on Rubicon I know you can do it!
You can't save your progress mid mission, which is unforgivable for a mobile game of this nature.
Difficulties levels are useless can't progress beyond lv 21 due to start with lack of recorces general killed in two moves by enemy basic lv same as hard.

This is the first game in the "war game" series I have played and I am really enjoying it so far. If this is the most disappointing, then I am even more excited to play the rest. My only complaint so far is lack of information/help with the levels, and weapons/artillery. For instance, it would be great to know what my previous record is on a level when I start it, not just after I finish it. Or when I upgrade a weapon/artillery, how much is the attack and defense being improved? Or when I am considering unlocking a new weapon/artillery, why cannot I not see what it's benefits and drawbacks are without having to try to buy one while playing a level?
Played all the GBW games n loved them, this seems half done, could have been made so much better
just started playing, seems really fun!

I still enjoy this installment of the series. I have played all of them. This one is a little different but still a lot of fun. The upgraded visuals are very nice. My only complaint is that they removed the ability to save mid-game. It would be nice if that would put that feature back in with an update.
When's the real sequel coming?
As many have said... Too easy and not up to par with earlier versions... Pity... Expected much better than ok...

Good: looks great, runs well, no IAPs, and more of the same good fun found in earlier titles.   Bad: no skirmish mode that I can see, no fog of war that I can tell, no real improvement over GBWG.  Had I used the money for this on the IAPs in GBWG I'd have virtually the same game, but with more maps and skirmish for not much price difference.  So this seems to be a greater value to new players, not as much for returning. Were there a skirmish mode, fog of war, and campaign reset, easy five stars.
replyContent: We're hearing that a lot thanks. And we will have a major udpate to GBWG too at some point soon.

content: in mission 25 about turn 5
Good but levels are to short
Much easier than the originals even on the harder difficultly levels, but still provides some fun snack size fights.
Played on the hardest difficulty and none of the levels where challenging. Fun, just to easy
Good real time strategy to pass the time when there is nothing to do. Really like this game
I've got all these GLWG games and there all good but theres nothing new here though. A good way to past the time cheers Rubicon ‚òÜ

I have every other game in the series, in both Android and PC format, and all the extras for both formats.  I enjoyed all of it, except for this.  This sucks.  Gameplay is too simple, on screen tips that can't be turned off treat you like a noob and the overall feeling you get is that this is the preschool version.  Sorry that I bought it.
Much fun!
Missions were too easy n map too small.  Pls don't buy.  The first GLW was much better

Loved GBWG and although I enjoyed this game, I was disappointed by how small the game was, how quickly I completed it and how easy it was. It did have a few nice UI improvements though. Let's hope the next installment will be a little more substantial.
Cracking little time killer
Great game only thing missing is a multi player mode
Crashes on galaxy tab pro 12.2 running 4.4.2.  Actually causes the tablet to reboot as well.

Having played all the previous versions of this addictive game, I had high hopes for this one. Unfortunately this is the worse version yet. On the most difficult setting its just too easy. I used to enjoy the videos between missions, but these appear to have been dropped. Menus during game play lack quality. Not just disappointed, but really disappointed. Rubicon can do a lot better than this.
Can't save automaticallyOnly the last got a little interest.I really disappointed it

No attempt at storyline /humor. Poor level design leaves you with little in terms of challenges. Waste of money. I've bought and completed all other GLWG releases, and this is uncharacteristically the worst one. Created to help with their car payments, not to have fun.
replyContent: Not car payments, mortgage payments. I own my ten year old car outright.

content: Too easy and boring....
Needs support for immersive mode

I definitely regret paying for this app.. Just seems like they threw it together at the last minute. Tiny maps that aren't really challenging at all, even on hard.. A poor showing.. I would not recommend buying it at all.

I've got all the *War Game games, and this was a nice addition. For me, it was more worth $1.99 than $2.99, but I'm not upset about the purchase. This installment felt more like additional levels to a previous game, than a game by itself.  I would have liked to have skirmishes to make this worth the full price. Personally I prefer the skirmishes of the other game as a quick diversion, and feel that I get more for my money when skirmishes are included. ** One very nice addition is the dynamic orientation, to zoom in and out. Very nice!

Bought to thank and support Rubicon for creating the best games to date on Android, GBWG and GLWG. Unfortunately this is not one of them. Still kinda fun but only by adding rules for myself like win all in 5 moves. I await a GBWG 2 hopefully with user created levels. Some options for this one would be nice too.

... But this was, as a lot of other people have said, far too easy. Probably about 4 hours of playtime in all. The levelling up of units seemed like a good idea but it wasn't clear what was actually improving. Not to mention that you can go the whole game without even needing some of them.  Any point in the anti-air tank when the AI never uses air units? Expected better.

Played all three previous games, each of which was great. This one is an afterthought, they obviously got an intern to throw together some new levels and get it out the door fast to make some cash. Only levels 30 and 60 were even vaguely challenging, and difficulty setting doesn't seem to make any difference. Go back and replay earlier games, save your money on this.
At first it bint work now it works
replyContent: Great

content: Awesome game, as are the rest in this series, but this one is way too easy even on hard.  There's a few tough missions but overall, kind of a disapointment.
This is a cheap knockoff compared to the original versions.  The "campaign" is 59 skirmish levels on basic maps with level 60 being the only interesting mission.
Says we haven't bought it....

This sequel does a lot that is worse than the last game, but not a lot better. The tactical side of the game has been watered down too much, the last level can be won by a grenadier and ferry and not much else. Some of the new units are ridiculously overpowered. The storyline no longer exists, which is a big loss. And the levels are far too repetitive. On the positive side, there is plenty of repetitive content and the gameplay still looks great. Play this as a warmup to the original game!
This game is the perfect introduction to Rubicon war games. The features are limited but the engine is refined.

I loved previous games in the series which were ground breaking; challenging with great stories and full of humour . I am disappointed to say that this is a poor relation. I have stuck with it, hoping it improves but it is far too easy and has a lack of story line. If you have got played the original games but one of them, but I would avoid this one. Sorry Rubicon but this is a sad end to what was an excellent and entertaining series of games
Still enjoyable, but feels like a step back from great big war game. No story, no multiplayer. Feels more like an extension pack than a stand alone game.
Completed on easy with ease, went to do campaign again on harder difficulty but unable to reset campaign. Levels could be bigger.
Find my self going back to gbwg far more games play this is just tiny maps all easy and very similar as they are so small it don't allow for variety
Crashes very frequently.. Could not complete missions. Sent sever crash reports.
but I'm one of those who much preferred a few more options like turning off battle zoom and some of the graphics, like the water.  it's pretty laggy on all 3 devices I have.

Understand, the last release in this series, Great Big War Game, is the greatest Android game ever. Go get it right now. Sadly, this game is a very disappointing follow up. The maps are tiny and boring, the changes to the rules (one engineer to capture an enemy base, unlimited ammo) make the game easier and less interesting, and the humor is gone. I am so very sad.
Guessing Ruby slacked on this one. Getting rich off this game. Did get my money though. Use ideas off the first part and it would be better. But for now it's crap.
Not worth the $3,  would prefer they made a new great big war game instead of this garbage

Not a patch on the originals. Enemy is too easy...  You're given far too many resources to fight with. Completed the whole thing in an hour... Loved the originals... This game would be OK had the original games not been sooo good.

Comparred to Great Big War Game, this game isn't that great. I can tell the scrpters spent a small amount of time creating the 60 levels. I finished nearly each level in under 10 turns. I love the series and keep playing GBWG periodically. This one was a disappointment.
Playable but same old same old. Could be better and harder.
you can work on the ai to make it less stupid. previous versions were not so dumb. still the game is very fun to play.
Big fan.
replyContent: Thank you, glad you like. :)

content: If you've played any of the previous ones, this is ridiculously easy. It really has been reduced to five-minute gaming. Small maps, easy solutions.
replyContent: Did you not see where exactly that was displayed on the store page? There is a difficulty selector for more challenge, but five minute missions is a deliberate design choice for a mobile game. Sorry you disapprove.

content: I guess they needed some money. How can you release an inferior game with less features and more bugs than the original version and call it a sequel? This is basically slapped together DLC that clearly wasn't even play tested. Even though they claim that the AI is identical to the previous games, it's somehow gotten much worse. There was zero challenge to these missions even on the hardest settings. The AI won't even protect their own base! I loved the first two games but this one was terrible.
replyContent: This app started out as a $2.99 dlc to GLWG, we've been quite public about that. But we wanted to add some improvements from GBWG too, hence a new app needed. For $2.99. As for the money comment, you think we're getting rich here? If only.. :(

content: Loved all previous games this one was too easy.  maps had little or no interaction or strategy as the first one did.  I beat most maps in 3-4 moves.  Its almost as if this was released quickly with little thought of content. Love the new ranking system but the AI doesnt respond well.  Level 60 was the closest map to many in the first game.  Please add expansion pack of big maps for those that want a bigger board.  Thanks!!  Update: just beat level 60 hard in 5 turns... not good.  i swear there is an AI issu
Not as good as first, no skirmish mode or multi player options,  still pretty cool tho... needs more for 5 stars.....
replyContent: Those weren't in the first game either, which this is an extension of. GBWG has all that stuff and that will be getting updated later in the year also. Sorry we missed you this time.

content: I have both the other games in the G*WG family and this is a nice update on the core mechanic with all un-needed fluff removed. display now rotates between portrait and landscape too :)
replyContent: Thanks muchly Alistair, glad you like. :)

content: Game is fun, some suggestions: 1.Show my previous best (days) on the level select screen. 2.Remember where I was on the level select page, so I don't have to keep scrolling when I replay the levels with a different difficulty. 3.Need smarter AI.
replyContent: Thanks, gone in the suggestions box. :)

content: fun

Loved all previous games but found this disappointing. Nothing new, poor lvl design and difficulty all over the place. Playing on hard and most levels ridiculously easy. I've reached lvl 23 though and ai spams me with 6 recon tanks, 2 grenaders, a sniper and 4 grunts in 1st 3 turns. And I've only 2 grunts and 2 oil well to start with. Dropped difficulty lvl and got past it. No thought has went into most of maps. Most appear too small. A real missed opportunity.
Good game but lacks challenges and desperately needs difficulty levels otherwise it's boring
replyContent: You now have difficulty levels as well as some other new stuff.

content: To easy
But I assume it will improve. Loved GBWG & GLWG. Pleased that I purchased it, happy to support the developer. Interested to see where this goes.
replyContent: Difficulty settings and other stuff in the new update.

content: Missing savegame feature that made the first game so much fun. add that bavk and 5* you will get! thanks
replyContent: Fixed. :)

content: Fun but add more levels

I love your games, huge fan. I feel more could have been done. Missions are basically the same, same units, less personality. If its going to be a sequel where are the improvements? I understand you want this game to be casual, but even so this sets the standards for your games lower. I hope you truely understand what I'm saying and am only trying to provide constructive criticism

It is just a bunch of multiplayer maps which are boring to play on single player and with no multiplayer mode. There is no effort on making challenging single player maps. Also the game is pretty much the same, except for a flame tank and lots of oversimplifications (no fog, no difficulty option, oversimplified upgrading scheme, no mp, no funny dialogs,...). It's very disappointing coming from this franchise.
replyContent: It was originally going to be an expansion - for $2.99. We wanted to work in a lot of improvements we made from GBWG too though, hence a new app.

content: When do the other machines and soldiers get unlocked? I'm on mission 45 now and they still haven't been unlocked. All I have is the first three soldiers and machines. The rest have never been unlocked. Grunt, bazooka, and engineer. Jeep, aniti-air, and recon tank. All I have is the ferry from boats and the skyhook from air. I've beat all missions up to 51 with just those now.
replyContent: What are you missing?  I can't remember off hand but it should all be available long before then.

content: These turn-based strategies from Rubicon are still the best I've ever found on Google Play. Couple of issues with this iteration such as not saving in the middle of a mission or lack of landscape support. The latter means units appear off screen when it shows long range shots. While it would be great to see these addressed the game is still amazingly fun to play. As with previous versions I'll definitely be playing through this one multiple times. Well worth every penny!
replyContent: Thank you. Landscape orientation is coming next update btw. :)

content: As others have said.... it's way too easy.  I know this will be addressed, and I hope the fog of war will be added to a more difficult setting.
So glad to see the new one out, it definitely has room for improvement in the next updates but overal a very well done game. Can't wait for GBWG sequel/update already !
Continue to excite.

I was very excited when number 2 arrived, only to be sorely disappointed. The game is way to easy with no way of changing the difficulty unlike it's predecessors. The new vehicles are cool and the game has undergone some well thought out changes, such as requiring only one engineer to capture a building.  However, the changes don't make up the shortcomings.
replyContent: Our next update should have a difficulty option in it.

content: I expected a lot more from this franchise. I absolutely loved great big war game, and its previous incarnations but this sucked
replyContent: Sorry we missed you this time. The AI is identical just ftr.

content: The game keeps crashing on level 21. I hope this gets fixed soon
replyContent: Sorry about this. We're trying to track down a memory leak that will cause a crash now and then. Until we get it updated, a reboot should do the trick.

content: The more I play, the more disappointed I am. The AI is weak and scenarios aren't challenging.
replyContent: AI is in fact identical.

content: Excellent game, wonderfully addictive. Not as good as the first which deserved 6 stars- where has the Generalisimo storyline gone? It looks like you listen to feedback which is great. Can please I ask for either Great Big War Game to be released in Japan or for you to fix the Great Little Wargame expansion to work on the Google Nexus series? Please?

I have played the other games in this series and find that this one is perfect for my phone rather than a tablet. Love the fact that I can get some game in when I only have 5 or so mins. Hope the developer isn't leaving the turn based gaming scene when they say this is the last of this series. I'd like to see more takes with the engine.

It just keeps getting better as far as I am concerned.This version seems more polished. I love the series and this is a very welcomed addition. 2.99 well spent. Thanks for this great little war game. Oh yes I forgot ..Itching to fight again!!!!

Fun game, but they really "stream lined" it too much compared to other games in the series.  Even basic useful information about units and unit upgrades is lacking. Game is also way too easy. Option for landscape gameplay would also be welcomed. That said, still worth the money I paid for it.
replyContent:
The update explains the upgrades - they all do the same thing which is now labelled.

Landscape is on its way in the next update.

content: Played the first 24 missions. Could have done in my sleep. Engineer + jeep or just building lots of 5star infantry has made every mission a breeze so far.
replyContent: That tactic is a bit a broken, I agree. We're trying to figure an elegant improvement.

content: Caveat: I've only played 20 missions. Similar to previous games, but no pinch-to-zoom, no idea what upgrades give you, no score for the mission depending on how fast you complete it, no fog of war (though this was only present in GBWG), the single-engineer-to-capture-a-building makes rushes too simple, and the worst part for me so far: it's way too easy. None of the first 20 missions have required any thought about how to go about winning. Still fun, but not nearly as good as GBWG.
replyContent:
We're thinking about what to do about engineer rushes. The previous setup confused a lot of people, but I agree it's too simple now.

The upgrades are explained with the update, as is a fix to pinch/zoom.

content: Just as awesome as the others
replyContent: Thanks muchly, glad you're enjoying! :)

content: Please fix to rotate the maps..
replyContent: On its way...

content: Come on guys, A Massive fan of all your games, but WHY oh Why have you removed landscape!!!  Have not even attempted to play this because of it.  Am Disappointed :(  all your games have suited a Landscape layout.
replyContent: We're woking on it now. I still feel its better in portrait, but we do listen to feedback so we'll be supporting both.

content: Is there no way to zoom out and see the entire battlefield, in this one?
replyContent: Pinch and zoom should work?

content: As soon as I saw that this game is available I got it, rate 5 stars without even playing it because the previous 3 are outstanding!!!
replyContent: Excellent, thanks Darryl. Hope you enjoy later. :)

content: Great turn based fun.
Cheaper than a portion of chips! And loads of game play. Can't argue with that.
Been waiting a long time for a new version of this game, and this is ace. The best war game out there.
